column2: ought to have sought relief not from the Supreme Court but from the Court of Appeal
under Article 140 of the Constitution, as what the Petitioners have sought to challenge
by  their  applications  are  decisions  of  Returning  Officers,  namely,  the  rejection  of  the
nomination papers by themâ€”as opposed to decisions of the Election Commission itself.
Let me start by stating that, according to section 31(2) of the Ordinance, the decision of
the  rejection  of  a  nomination  paper  by  the  returning  officer  is  final  and  conclusive
without any involvement of the Commission.
